title: Kids With Most Candies
content: Assess an array of kids with candies to determine if each kid, after receiving extra candies, will have the most candies among all kids. Each kid's current candies count is given in the array candies, along with the number of extra candies available. Return an array result indicating true if the ith kid will have the most candies after receiving extra candies, and false otherwise.

testCases.description: If you give all extraCandies to: - Kid 1, they will have 2 + 3 = 5 candies, which is the greatest among the kids. - Kid 2, they will have 3 + 3 = 6 candies, which is the greatest among the kids. - Kid 3, they will have 5 + 3 = 8 candies, which is the greatest among the kids. - Kid 4, they will have 1 + 3 = 4 candies, which is not the greatest among the kids. - Kid 5, they will have 3 + 3 = 6 candies, which is the greatest among the kids.
There is only 1 extra candy. Kid 1 will always have the greatest number of candies, even if a different kid is given the extra candy.

inputFormat:
```
- First line contains integer `n` determining no of kids
- Second line contains elements of array `candies` determining the no of candies ith kid has
- Third line contains an integer `extraCandies`
```
outputFormat: Print the boolean results for each kid in a single line as a list-like representation, for example: [true,true,false].
